questiontext.text:
The Maclaurin expansion for sin($$\small\theta$$) provides a "small angle" approximation: sin($$\small\theta$$) $$\small\approx$$ $$\small\theta$$.
What is the smallest positive angle at which this approximation gives and error of 10$$\small\%$$
Express your answer to the nearest degree.

Answer :
{1:NUMERICAL:=43:1#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
The error for $$\small \theta$$ is given by :
$$\small \frac{sin(\theta) - \theta}{sin(\theta)}$$ x 100%
Using a calculator, the error is found to be 10% at $$\small \theta$$ $$\small \approx$$ 0.74875 radians or about 42.9 degrees.
Smallest positive angle = 43 degrees.
